intro: Acomastylis × macrantha, commonly known as the hybrid bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and has a compact, bushy habit with narrow, strap-like leaves. It produces showy inflorescences that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and partial shade to thrive.
